item.title: More PHP Help
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

it means you are back to doing

‘$skill[‘overall’]’[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2008, 03:56:10 PM[/size][hr][quote=“d_sign, post:4, topic:195242”]Tried that,
phpMyAdmin gave me this:

#1064 - You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near ''id' ,'username' ,'overall' ,'attack' ,'strength' ,'defence' ,'hitpoints' ,'magi' at line 1

The program now just echos the query, too
http://phpindev.ulmb.com/Hiscores-History/history.php?user=zezima[/quote]
that means their is mysql error in ur syntax

item.title: More PHP Help
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:2, topic:195242”]Just do it like this:

[code]

<?PHP /* Yanille.com Hiscores History Written by Marineguyfla Version 0.1 */ require("stats.php"); if (!isset($user)){ die("No username entered"); } $hostname=""; $user=""; //user name to access database $pass= ""; //password $dbase=""; //database name $connection = mysql_connect("$hostname" , "$user" , "$pass") or die ("Cannot connect to MySQL"); $db = mysql_select_db($dbase , $connection) or die ("Cannot select database."); $q="insert into history('id' ,'username' ,'overall' ,'attack' ,'strength' ,'defence' ,'hitpoints' ,'magic' ,'ranged' ,'woodcutting' ,'fletching' ,'firemaking' ,'cooking' ,'fishing' ,'theiving' ,'prayer' ,'crafting' ,'mining' ,'smithing' ,'herblore' ,'slayer' ,'runecraft' ,'farming' ,'hunter' ,'construction' ,'summoning') VALUES ('' , '".$user."', '".$skill['overall']."', '".$skill['attack']."', '".$skill['strength']."', '".$skill['defence']."', '".$skill['hp']."', '".$skill['magic']."', '".$skill['ranged']."', '".$skill['woodcutting']."', '".$skill['fletching']."', '".$skill['firemaking']."', '".$skill['cooking']."', '".$skill['fishing']."', '".$skill['theiving']."', '".$skill['prayer']."', '".$skill['crafting']."', '".$skill['mining']."', '".$skill['smithing']."', '".$skill['herblore']."', '".$skill['slayer']."', '".$skill['runecraft']."', '".$skill['farming']."','". $skill['hunter']."', '".$skill['construction']."', '".$skill['summoning']."')"; mysql_query($q); echo "skills entered"; ?>[/code]

Just have it add it. And then say “Skills entered” after it.

PS: You have two $user variables.[/quote]

bad way to do it since it can fail and u will never know

his way is correct but since its not echoing seems to point out that there is something wrong with the query

echo out the query and see what it looks like and try to add it through phpmyadmin or something like that

edit: oorrr you fucked up the login info with the user name of player being $user and the login for mysql to be $user
fix that and check your query

Read full topic

item.title: More PHP Help
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Just do it like this:

[code]

<?PHP /* Yanille.com Hiscores History Written by Marineguyfla Version 0.1 */ require("stats.php"); if (!isset($user)){ die("No username entered"); } $hostname=""; $user=""; //user name to access database $pass= ""; //password $dbase=""; //database name $connection = mysql_connect("$hostname" , "$user" , "$pass") or die ("Cannot connect to MySQL"); $db = mysql_select_db($dbase , $connection) or die ("Cannot select database."); $q="insert into history('id' ,'username' ,'overall' ,'attack' ,'strength' ,'defence' ,'hitpoints' ,'magic' ,'ranged' ,'woodcutting' ,'fletching' ,'firemaking' ,'cooking' ,'fishing' ,'theiving' ,'prayer' ,'crafting' ,'mining' ,'smithing' ,'herblore' ,'slayer' ,'runecraft' ,'farming' ,'hunter' ,'construction' ,'summoning') VALUES ('' , '".$user."', '".$skill['overall']."', '".$skill['attack']."', '".$skill['strength']."', '".$skill['defence']."', '".$skill['hp']."', '".$skill['magic']."', '".$skill['ranged']."', '".$skill['woodcutting']."', '".$skill['fletching']."', '".$skill['firemaking']."', '".$skill['cooking']."', '".$skill['fishing']."', '".$skill['theiving']."', '".$skill['prayer']."', '".$skill['crafting']."', '".$skill['mining']."', '".$skill['smithing']."', '".$skill['herblore']."', '".$skill['slayer']."', '".$skill['runecraft']."', '".$skill['farming']."','". $skill['hunter']."', '".$skill['construction']."', '".$skill['summoning']."')"; mysql_query($q); echo "skills entered"; ?>[/code]

Just have it add it. And then say “Skills entered” after it.

PS: You have two $user variables.

Read full topic

item.title: More PHP Help
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

Still on the Hiscores history, got rid of errors, but now what?
New code: [code]<?PHP
require(“stats.php”);
if (!isset($user)){
die(“No username entered”);
}
$hostname="";
$user=""; //user name to access database
$pass= “”; //password
$dbase=""; //database name

$connection = mysql_connect("$hostname" , “$user” , “$pass”) or die (“Cannot connect to MySQL”);
$db = mysql_select_db($dbase , $connection) or die (“Cannot select database.”);

$q="insert into history('id' ,'username' ,'overall' ,'attack' ,'strength' ,'defence' ,'hitpoints' ,'magic' ,'ranged' ,'woodcutting' ,'fletching' ,'firemaking' ,'cooking' ,'fishing' ,'theiving' ,'prayer' ,'crafting' ,'mining' ,'smithing' ,'herblore' ,'slayer' ,'runecraft' ,'farming' ,'hunter' ,'construction' ,'summoning')
VALUES ('' , '".$user."', '".$skill['overall']."', '".$skill['attack']."', '".$skill['strength']."', '".$skill['defence']."', '".$skill['hp']."', '".$skill['magic']."', '".$skill['ranged']."', '".$skill['woodcutting']."', '".$skill['fletching']."', '".$skill['firemaking']."', 
'".$skill['cooking']."', '".$skill['fishing']."', '".$skill['theiving']."', '".$skill['prayer']."', '".$skill['crafting']."', '".$skill['mining']."', '".$skill['smithing']."', '".$skill['herblore']."', '".$skill['slayer']."', '".$skill['runecraft']."', '".$skill['farming']."','". $skill['hunter']."', '".$skill['construction']."', '".$skill['summoning']."')";
$result = mysql_query($q);

if ($result)
{
    echo "skills entered";
}

?>[/code]

http://phpindev.ulmb.com/Hiscores-History/history.php?user=USERNAME

It’s supposed to say “skills entered” but it says nothing…
Thanks for the help

Read full topic
